snippet: Ruben W. Wills, a Democrat who represents southeastern Queens, was arrested Wednesday morning on charges of misusing public funds.
abstract: New York City Councilman Ruben W Wills, Democrat who represents southeastern Queens, is arrested on charges of misusing public funds; indictment includes multiple counts of fraud and larceny in connection with more than $30,000 in public funds that went missing from charity Wills used to run; Wills and a relative are also accused of conspiring to steal public campaign funds by creating fraudulent business.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and MARC SANTORA
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Thomas Kaplan, William K. Rashbaum, Nate Schweber and Kate Taylor.

lead_paragraph: Ruben W. Wills, a Democrat who represents southeastern Queens, was arrested Wednesday morning on charges of misusing public funds.

headline.main: Councilman Is Accused of Stealing Public Funds
headline.print_headline: Councilman Is Accused of Stealing Public Funds
